intro: Jurinea serpenticaulis, commonly known as the serpent's tail, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, characterized by its succulent leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are fleshy and often arranged in a rosette pattern, helping to conserve water. Jurinea serpenticaulis is often found in rocky soils and is well adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
